2.text: Hear my words, ye wise men; and give ear unto me, ye that have knowledge.

3.text: For the ear trieth words, as the palate tasteth meat.

4.text: Let us choose for us that which is right: let us know among ourselves what is good.

5.text: For Job hath said, I am righteous, and God hath taken away my right:

6.text: Notwithstanding my right I am accounted a liar; my wound is incurable, though I am without transgression.

7.text: What man is like Job, who drinketh up scorning like water?

8.text: Which goeth in company with the workers of iniquity, and walketh with wicked men.

9.text: For he hath said, it profiteth a man nothing that he should delight himself with God.

10.text: Therefore hearken unto me, ye men of understanding: far be it from God, that he should do wickedness; and from the Almighty, that he should commit iniquity.

11.text: For the work of a man shall he render unto him, and cause every man to find according to his ways.

12.text: Yea, of a surety, God will not do wickedly, neither will the Almighty pervert judgment.

13.text: Who gave him a charge over the earth? or who hath disposed the whole world?

14.text: If he set his heart upon man, if he gather unto himself his spirit and his breath;

15.text: All flesh shall perish together, and man shall turn again unto dust.

16.text: If now thou hast understanding, hear this: hearken to the voice of my words.

17.text: Shall even one that hateth right govern? and wilt thou condemn him that is just and mighty?

18.text: Is it fit to say to a king, Thou art vile? or to nobles, Ye are wicked?

19.text: How much less to him that respecteth not the persons of princes, nor regardeth the rich more than the poor? for they all are the work of his hands.

20.text: In a moment they die, even at midnight; the people are shaken and pass away, and the mighty are taken away without hand.

21.text: For his eyes are upon the ways of a man, and he seeth all his goings.

22.text: There is no darkness, nor shadow of death, where the workers of iniquity may hide themselves.

23.text: For he needeth not further to consider a man, that he should go before God in judgment.

24.text: He breaketh in pieces mighty men in ways past finding out, and setteth others in their stead.

25.text: Therefore he taketh knowledge of their works; and he overturneth them in the night, so that they are destroyed.

26.text: He striketh them as wicked men in the open sight of others;

27.text: Because they turned aside from following him, and would not have regard to any of his ways:

28.text: So that they caused the cry of the poor to come unto him, and he heard the cry of the afflicted.

29.text: When he giveth quietness, who then can condemn? and when he hideth his face, who then can behold him? whether it be done unto a nation, or unto a man, alike:

30.text: That the godless man reign not, that there be none to ensnare the people.

31.text: For hath any said unto God, I have borne chastisement, I will not offend any more:

32.text: That which I see not teach thou me: if I have done iniquity, I will do it no more?

33.text: Shall his recompence be as thou wilt, that thou refusest it? for thou must choose, and not I: therefore speak what thou knowest.

34.text: Men of understanding will say unto me, yea, every wise man that heareth me:

35.text: Job speaketh without knowledge, and his words are without wisdom.

36.text: Would that Job were tried unto the end, because of his answering like wicked men.

37.text: For he addeth rebellion unto his sin, he clappeth his hands among us, and multiplieth his words against God.
